Notes.Text:
This update for cifs-utils fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2020-14342: Fixed a shell command injection vulnerability in mount.cifs (bsc#1174477).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: It was found that cifs-utils' mount.cifs was invoking a shell when requesting the Samba password, which could be used to inject arbitrary commands. An attacker able to invoke mount.cifs with special permission, such as via sudo rules, could use this flaw to escalate their privileges.
